summary: They never lose hope when everything's cold and the fighting's near It's deep in their bones, they'll run into smoke when the...
caption:
They never lose hope when everything’s cold and the fighting’s near
It’s deep in their bones, they’ll run into smoke when the fire is fierce
When everything’s lost, they pick up their hearts and avenge defeat
Before it all starts, they suffer through harm just to touch a dream

blog.name: tony-slank
blog.title: endgame killed me
blog.description: i’m a bad writer who is in need of somewhere to post their works

summary: AUTHORS NOTE: this obviously will contain Endgame Spoilers and is going to be a turn on it. if you haven’t seen it, keep...
body:
ENDGAME: HOW IT SHOULD HAVE HAPPENED

AUTHORS NOTE: this obviously will contain Endgame Spoilers and is going to be a turn on it. if you haven’t seen it, keep scrolling if not pls read. this is a clintasha story on what i believe should have happened ps. i attached a song you can listen to while reading this :))


i can’t let him die. that was all natasha was thinking as she dove over the cliff after clint.

i can’t let nat die. that was what clint was thinking when he jumped off the cliff.

neither one knew what the other one was thinking when they jumped off of the cliff for each other but what they did realize as they were hanging over the edge of the cliff- clint holding onto Natasha tightly, desperately trying to hold her up from falling- was that they loved each other too much to lose the other.

“let me go” clint heard natasha saying. and his heart stopped. how could she think he would just let her go? natasha was his partner, his friend, his true love. he’d never told natasha but he figured that with everything they went through together she knew.

“never nat. i won’t let go” natasha heard clint say. natasha didn’t know what to do. she needed to do this. she couldn’t let him die. she just couldn’t do it.

“clint please. just let go. you have a family to get back to, i don’t have anyone waiting for me”

as soon as these words left natasha’s mouth clint objected telling natasha she was his family before saying “your my family nat, i may have a family of my own but i’ll always pick you. if you die i can’t live with myself” natasha felt her heart warm up and felt the tears she had been holding back slide down her face as both her and clint were now crying, barely holding on to the cliff and each other.

“and i can? clint i can’t let you die. your the only one i have left, i can’t let anything happen to you.” the two looked at each other crying not knowing what to say when all the sudden the wire holding them up snapped. the two were still holding hands and clint grabbed onto natasha’s body, hugging her, as they fell hoping his body would help to provide protection from their fall.

please don’t die on me. the two were thinking the same thing over and over. clint was all natasha had and natasha was all clint had and in these moments of their fall nothing else mattered.

clint watched as they reached closer to the ground squeezing his eyes shut and grabbing natasha tighter.

the two hit the ground and almost immediately passed out only to wake up moments later still holding hands.

clint felt something in his hand that was interlocked with natasha’s and he didn’t know what it was or where he was. it looked like he was still on Vormir but they weren’t on the ground of the cliff anymore but instead back at the bottom of the cliff.

natasha. clint thought of her and immediately turned to look beside him only to find natasha still knocked out.

no no no. clint kept repeating this over and over in his head. she couldn’t be dead. he couldn’t live without his natasha. he didn’t know what to do and instead turned his body to her trying to check for a pulse.

ba bump ba bump. he heard a heartbeat. it was slightly slow and he didn’t know what to do about that but all that mattered right now was that she was alive.

zap. clint felt a shock go through his body coming from his hand that was connected with natasha’s and removed his hand from hers only to be looking at the soul stone that was resting in natasha’s hand looking harmless even though it had just shocked him moments before.

zap. clint heard another zap come from it and instead of going into him this time it went into natasha and he watched as her veins glowed orange for a second before natasha flew up from the ground looking around her. her eyes found clint and she immediately relaxed.

“don’t you dare do that to me again” was the first this natasha said before she was hugged by clint who gave her an immediate response.

“never” and he meant it. clint would never leave natasha’s side again and natasha wasn’t going to object at all for finally both her and clint were happy together and would be together finally after years of denying all feelings between each other.

AUTHORS NOTE: if you didn’t understand the stone zapping this was to represent it taking half their souls so they both can still live

ENDGAME: HOW IT SHOULD HAVE HAPPENED

AUTHORS NOTE: this obviously will contain Endgame Spoilers and is going to be a turn on it. if you haven’t seen it, keep scrolling if not pls read. this is a clintasha story on what i believe should have happened ps. i attached a song you can listen to while reading this :))


i can’t let him die. that was all natasha was thinking as she dove over the cliff after clint.

i can’t let nat die. that was what clint was thinking when he jumped off the cliff.

neither one knew what the other one was thinking when they jumped off of the cliff for each other but what they did realize as they were hanging over the edge of the cliff- clint holding onto Natasha tightly, desperately trying to hold her up from falling- was that they loved each other too much to lose the other.

“let me go” clint heard natasha saying. and his heart stopped. how could she think he would just let her go? natasha was his partner, his friend, his true love. he’d never told natasha but he figured that with everything they went through together she knew.

“never nat. i won’t let go” natasha heard clint say. natasha didn’t know what to do. she needed to do this. she couldn’t let him die. she just couldn’t do it.

“clint please. just let go. you have a family to get back to, i don’t have anyone waiting for me”

as soon as these words left natasha’s mouth clint objected telling natasha she was his family before saying “your my family nat, i may have a family of my own but i’ll always pick you. if you die i can’t live with myself” natasha felt her heart warm up and felt the tears she had been holding back slide down her face as both her and clint were now crying, barely holding on to the cliff and each other.

“and i can? clint i can’t let you die. your the only one i have left, i can’t let anything happen to you.” the two looked at each other crying not knowing what to say when all the sudden the wire holding them up snapped. the two were still holding hands and clint grabbed onto natasha’s body, hugging her, as they fell hoping his body would help to provide protection from their fall.

please don’t die on me. the two were thinking the same thing over and over. clint was all natasha had and natasha was all clint had and in these moments of their fall nothing else mattered.

clint watched as they reached closer to the ground squeezing his eyes shut and grabbing natasha tighter.

the two hit the ground and almost immediately passed out only to wake up moments later still holding hands.

clint felt something in his hand that was interlocked with natasha’s and he didn’t know what it was or where he was. it looked like he was still on Vormir but they weren’t on the ground of the cliff anymore but instead back at the bottom of the cliff.

natasha. clint thought of her and immediately turned to look beside him only to find natasha still knocked out.

no no no. clint kept repeating this over and over in his head. she couldn’t be dead. he couldn’t live without his natasha. he didn’t know what to do and instead turned his body to her trying to check for a pulse.

ba bump ba bump. he heard a heartbeat. it was slightly slow and he didn’t know what to do about that but all that mattered right now was that she was alive.

zap. clint felt a shock go through his body coming from his hand that was connected with natasha’s and removed his hand from hers only to be looking at the soul stone that was resting in natasha’s hand looking harmless even though it had just shocked him moments before.

zap. clint heard another zap come from it and instead of going into him this time it went into natasha and he watched as her veins glowed orange for a second before natasha flew up from the ground looking around her. her eyes found clint and she immediately relaxed.

“don’t you dare do that to me again” was the first this natasha said before she was hugged by clint who gave her an immediate response.

“never” and he meant it. clint would never leave natasha’s side again and natasha wasn’t going to object at all for finally both her and clint were happy together and would be together finally after years of denying all feelings between each other.

tags: i still have a lot of emotions about this
is i think how you spell that
title: Endgame Theory I Guess
body:
Last night, at 3 am, I realized in a stroke of genius that at the end of the movie, Steve must take the hammer back to Asgard to return it which is why there’s no hammer with him later. Additionally, this probably means that he ran into Frigga and I imagine the conversation went something along the lines of:

“Hello Your Majesty, Thor’s Mom, uh, this is gonna sound weird but when you die, could you keep an eye out for my friend, Tony Stark? I don’t really know how any of this works anymore, but I figure if anyone deserves to go to Valhalla it’d be him. I don’t want to leave him alone again if I can help it.”

And then through a series of shenanigans, he’ll see Loki pretending to be him, do a once over and then say:

“Yep. Still America’s Ass.”

title: Voicemails from Peter Parker
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2GLodpf

by Llama_and_Lion

Since Germany, Peter had called him frequently, leaving weekly reports about his patrols as Spiderman. Tony had hoarded them like a squirrel, every message, every article, every video that popped up online, keeping a close eye at all times. He’d thought that staying out of Peter’s hero life would protect him, that those weekly lab sessions would be enough to stop Peter asking about when the next ‘Avengers saving the world’ thing was going to be. The messages he’s never replied to, just saved into a file labelled ‘Peters 18th’ because there was definitely enough funny and embarrassing stuff in there for Tony to bring up and torment the kid with.

But Peter was never going to turn 18.

Peter was never going to leave another voicemail.

Words: 4167, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

Series: Part 2 of Running up that hill

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, Marvel
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply

  • Relationships: Peter Parker & Tony Stark, Pepper Potts/Tony Stark

summary: There's So Much I Feel That I Should Say
title: There's So Much I Feel That I Should Say
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2V3a0xM

by Viretta91

At this point, Peter shouldn’t have been so surprised. He should have some kind of manual, some kind of system to deal with this never-ending loss. But no, each empty space around him was like an ugly, infected wound on his conscience.

OR:

How do you move on after the snap? After lost years? After lost friends?

  • Relationships: Peter Parker & Tony Stark, Pepper Potts/Tony Stark

I will never feel happy again.

blog.name: disparatepeace
blog.title: Bound to You
blog.description: Artist. Wanna - be writer (mostly fanfiction) Peter Parker is the son Tony Stark deserves and no one can say otherwise. Am a filthy Reylo and proud. Ironstrange is life. THIS IS A SHIP HATE-FREE BLOG!!! Respects all fandoms as long as they are respectful in return. No patience for antis. Favorite fandoms: BBC Sherlock, Star Wars, Disney and Marvel. Love animation. And cute animals. Icon was made by my good friend, @chandrilasky

summary: Even though Tony died in Endgame (which was bullshit by the way. Damn you Russos), he fulfilled everything he set out to do...
body:
Even though Tony died in Endgame (which was bullshit by the way. Damn you Russos), he fulfilled everything he set out to do before he left:

-He returned to Earth safely after drifting out in space for days.

-Married Pepper

-Finally had his kid, whom he named Morgan.

-Rejoined his team.

-Made amends with Steve and gave him his shield.

-Played a crucial role in the team’s time travel mission.

-Spoke with his father and made peace with him.

-Helped bring everyone that was snapped back.

-Helped kick the shit out of Thanos.

-Was reunited with his son Peter and finally gave him a proper hug.

-Kicked ass alongside his bae, Pepper.

-Obtained all six of the Infinity Stones and snapped that fucker Thanos and the rest of his crew out of existence.

He died not only as a hero, but as a complete man.
